children.subject: The goal of participating in the ULAB program as a student is to submit a project proposal & budget and subsequently execute that project. The project you and your group select will have to be 1 semester-1 year feasible, but other than that, there's no real limit to the various project topics you can work on. Everything's student-determined.
Are there more specifics to what various projects ULAB ATG is working on?

history.content:
Interested in computer science, software development, or other related subjects and their connection to research? Then this application is for you! The ULAB Advanced Technologies Group has their member application up!! Note that this application is due on Sunday September 2nd at 11:59 PM, with subsequent rolling admission until September 7th at 11:59 PM.

There is no prior computer science experience needed! This program is designed to teach students in a smaller group setting how to apply their software development skills to the research process through various projects during the Fall Semester, and we hope to expose students to assist in developing actual programs for research groups on campus during the Spring Semester.

APPLY NOW!! You can learn more and also check out other available applications on our website: ulab.berkeley.edu

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd22cFsyWXDVcjOFRSTuI0mrbGLfnHFHOmc5TPqLQmaQYGAtQ/viewform
history.subject: APPLY: ULAB Advanced Technologies Group
